V.iii.2.B.2.k
.
Audiometric Values Above 105 Decibels
If audiometric testing results contain a value above 105 decibels, enter the value into the hearing loss calculator at no higher than 105 decibels for the purpose of determining the puretone threshold average as directed by
VA’s Handbook of Standard Procedures and Best Practices for Audiology Compensation and Pension Examinations
.
Example
:  Findings of loss of 115 decibels at the 4000 Hz frequency level will be entered as 105 decibels into the hearing loss calculator.
title: M21-1, Part V, Subpart iii, Chapter 2, Section B - Conditions of the Auditory System
citation: Part V, Subpart iii, Chapter 2, Section B
